metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19963 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in wolfSSL before 4.3.0 in a non-default configuration where DSA is enabled. DSA signing uses the BEEA algorithm during modular inversion of the nonce, leading to a side-channel attack against the nonce.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl24 - 4.3.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0+dfsg-2').
